conservationist, illustrated Jex-Blakes, Muriel: Some Wildflowers of Kenya. 1948
Mycologist at Plant Pathology laboratory at Kew and Harpenden. Did pioneer research work on red core disease of strawberries. Contr. to Trans. Bot. Soc. Edinburgh
american plant pathologist

Tasmania's first professional woman artist. Mary Allport painted miniatures, landscapes and studies of flora and fauna. Flowers in the wild, rather than in formal gardens, apparently appealed to Mary Allport as subjects.

column15: paleontologist - Gates (1998: 71) zitiert aus Charles Dicken's magazine All the Year Round (1865) einen anonymen Autoren über Anning eine inscription under her memorial window: "it [geology] was not a science when she began to discover, and so [she] helped to make it one."
bras. Botanikerin

South Australian flower painter. In dem vom South Australian Museum Board 1981 hrsg. 'Alison Ashby's Wildflowers of Southern Australia' -Band sind 34  Beispiele ihrer Zeichnungen. named after her: Acacia ashbyae und Solanum ashbyae.
Assistant mycologist. R. Hort. Soc. Garden, Wisley, Surrey, 1935-1944

of Youghal, County Cork. collected seaweeds, flowering plants, and butterflies along the Irsih Coast; Algologist, assisted W. H. Harvey in 'Phycologia Britannica' 1846-1851. named after her: Ballia callitricha Harvey and Cladophora balliana.

painter of flowers, Schülerin von Aubriet - Malerin, Schülerin des Hofmalers des Kardinals Rohan, Robert de Séri (1686-1733). - Mitarbeit an (Nr. 550) Duhamel du Monceau, H. L.: Traité des arbres fruitiers. Paris 1768 - ledig - Schiebinger: Bernard de Jussieu schätzte ihre Arbeit

column15: älteste Tochter von C. v. Linné. Linné nimmt ihre Beobachtungen in Species Plantarum auf. E. Darwin: "Miss E. C. Demonstrator in Botany, Liverpool, 1912. Head of Botany Dept. Royal Holloway Coll. 1922-1949. President British Mycological Soc. 1942. Contr. to Trans. Br. Mycol. Soc.
belgische Botanikerin, mycologist,

Educator at  Anton Ulrich v. Erath's family in Dillenburg. Collected plants in Oranien-Nassau (today: Hessen, Germany). Made plant and flower paintings. Not married. 
Author of: 'Verzeichniß und Beschreibung der sämtlichen in den Fürstlich Oranien-Nassauischen Landen wildwachsenden Gewächse.' c. 800 sheets in seven vols. Herborn 1777. 
Drawings for  A. U. Erath's  'Codex diplomaticus Quedlinburgensis'. 1764.  
Member of 'Società botanica fiorentina' (1766), 'Gesellschaft Naturforschender Freunde zu Berlin (1776) and  'Regensburgische Botanische Gesellschaft' (1790). 
Reichenbach dedicated to her - and 10 other ladies - his book 'Botanik für Damen', Leipzig 1828.
